Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Object

Class Boundary

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.shape.Shape
javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle
com.example.demo.Object.Boundary
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Boundary extends javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle
The Boundary class represents the boundaries of the game area. It extends Rectangle and is used to create the left and right boundary markers for the game. The boundaries ensure that the objects within the game do not move outside the defined area.

This class provides methods to create the left and right boundaries with predefined positions and sizes. It also allows for potential future extension to dynamically update the boundary's position.

  • Field Details

    • RIGHT_BOUNDARY_X

      public static final double RIGHT_BOUNDARY_X
      The X position for the right boundary. This constant is used to set the position of the right boundary at the edge of the game area.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LEFT_BOUNDARY_X

      public static final double LEFT_BOUNDARY_X
      The X position for the left boundary. This constant is used to set the position of the left boundary at the left edge of the game area.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOUNDARY_Y

      public static final double BOUNDARY_Y
      The Y position for both boundaries. This constant is used to set the vertical position for both the left and right boundaries, ensuring they are aligned along the same horizontal line.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOUNDARY_WIDTH

      public static final double BOUNDARY_WIDTH
      The width of the boundary. This constant defines the width of the boundary, which is set to 1px to make it invisible.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOUNDARY_HEIGHT

      public static final double BOUNDARY_HEIGHT
      The height of the boundary. This constant defines the height of the boundary, ensuring it extends from the top to the bottom of the game area.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Boundary

      public Boundary(double initialXPos, double initialYPos, double width, double height)
      Constructs a new Boundary with the specified position and dimensions.

      The boundary is created as an invisible rectangle with the specified width and height.

      Parameters:
      initialXPos - The initial X position of the boundary.
      initialYPos - The initial Y position of the boundary.
      width - The width of the boundary.
      height - The height of the boundary.

  • Method Details

    • createRightBoundary

      public static Boundary createRightBoundary()
      Creates and returns a new Boundary representing the right boundary.

      The right boundary is positioned at the RIGHT_BOUNDARY_X constant with the predefined height and width.

      Returns:
      A new Boundary object representing the right boundary.

    • createLeftBoundary

      public static Boundary createLeftBoundary()
      Creates and returns a new Boundary representing the left boundary.

      The left boundary is positioned at the LEFT_BOUNDARY_X constant with the predefined height and width.

      Returns:
      A new Boundary object representing the left boundary.

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the position of the boundary.

      This method is currently not in use but is provided for potential future extensions where dynamic position updates might be required (e.g., for moving boundaries).
